While the tests considered in the previous section were of the difference between the
means of two independent samples, sometimes our samples may be dependent. If the
observations in the two samples both depend on some other factor, we can construct a
"paired comparisons” test of whether the means of the differences between observations
for the two samples are different. Dependence may result from an event that affects both
sets of observations for a number of companies or because observations for two firms
over time are both influenced by market returns or economic conditions.
